intro: Commiphora sphaerophylla, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous bark and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and is known for its ability to exude a fragrant gum when the bark is damaged. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland savanna regions. Its unique botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and medicinal purposes.
